result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
3:29 PM Defendant Lavonte Shermaine Davis in court in custody of the Ozaukee County Jail and by Attorney Allison Marie Ritter. Attorney Benjamin Lindsay in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant advised of complaint/penalties thereof. Officer A. Anjum sworn and testified. Exam by Atty. Lindsay, cross exam by Atty. Ritter, exam by Court. Atty. Ritter moves to dismiss. Court finds probable cause and binds case over for trial. State files information. Defense waives reading and enters not guilty plea. Atty. Ritter motion for bail reduction. State opposes reduction. Court denies motion to reduce bail.
Further proceedings scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Further proceedings on August 24, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
for bail reduction. Doc for review to Clerk DK

1:21 PM Prosecuting attorney Kerra Stumbris in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Lavonte Shermaine Davis appeared by video, in custody at Ozaukee County Jail.  Attorney Heather Dvoran in court for Lavonte Shermaine Davis. Counsel acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading. Defendant does qualify for PD representation. Court reviews charges/penalties and finds probable cause. State requesting $15,000 with conditions.
